thread.title: Thirty firefighters bring farm blaze under control | -
thread.title_full: Thirty firefighters bring farm blaze under control | Border - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Thirty firefighters bring farm blaze under control | -
text:
It is believed the fire began upstairs, and spread through the roof. Credit: ITV Border Thirty firefighters have brought a farmhouse blaze at Crossmichael, near Castle Douglas, under control.
The building at Drumskelly, on the outskirts of Crossmichael village, was gutted by the fire, which took three hours to tackle.
Fire crews from Castle Douglas, Dalbeattie, Gatehouse of Fleet and Dumfries were involved in the operation.
It is believed the fire began upstairs, and spread through the roof. Credit: ITV Border It is believed the fire began upstairs, and spread through the roof. Credit: ITV Border The fire is thought to have started upstairs in the house. It spread quickly and flames were going through the roof before the firefighters arrived on the scene.
The couple who live there managed to escape unhurt and alert the emergency services.
Last updated Fri 3 Feb 2017 Dumfries and Galloway crossmichael
